author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

guild.description:
This guild is about News far and wide!

Sister guild: +Commentary

#1. Things that are posted to News should be stated like a fact in the Headline.

In the sense, Headline: X happened or X said this. Not Personal opinions. 

They should be reporting.

#2. Personal slant or commentary should go in the comments, not the Headline. Commentary content (like discussion commentator shows) are not News. Commentary content will be redirected to +Commentary which is for that purpose. 

If it's News but is more an opinion piece please add [Opinion] in the title, or post in a topic specific guild. 

#3. No screenshots; provide a link, provide a source.

See Posting Etiquette pin for further explanation.

If it's News but is more an opinion piece please add [Opinion] in the title, or post in a topic specific guild.

#3. No screenshots; provide a link, provide a source.

See Posting Etiquette pin for further explanation.

post.title: President Trump to ban TikTok from the US today

body: This isn't good and people here shouldn't be celebrating this. To be clear, I wouldn't let Tiktok anywhere near my devices but once the president can arbitrarily ban software on a whim, it opens the slippery slope of censorship
body_html: This isn't good and people here shouldn't be celebrating this. To be clear, I wouldn't let Tiktok anywhere near my devices but once the president can arbitrarily ban software on a whim, it opens the slippery slope of censorship

post.title: President Trump to ban TikTok from the US today

body: This is different. China owns tiktok. He's not just banning some random app. He's banning an app that takes part in Chinese espionage. This isn't about censorship, it's about national sovereignty.
body_html: This is different. China owns tiktok. He's not just banning some random app. He's banning an app that takes part in Chinese espionage. This isn't about censorship, it's about national sovereignty.

post.title: President Trump to ban TikTok from the US today

body: I don't use TikTok for privacy and security reasons, and I don't recommend anyone else do so either. That said, Trump has no authority to tell private citizens what apps or sites they can use on their personal devices, and anyone cheering for this kind of censorship should give some serious thought to how that sort of control could be used to suppress other sources of information.
body_html: I don't use TikTok for privacy and security reasons, and I don't recommend anyone else do so either. That said, Trump has no authority to tell private citizens what apps or sites they can use on their personal devices, and anyone cheering for this kind of censorship should give some serious thought to how that sort of control could be used to suppress other sources of information.

parent.body: I don't use TikTok for privacy and security reasons, and I don't recommend anyone else do so either. That said, Trump has no authority to tell private citizens what apps or sites they can use on their personal devices, and anyone cheering for this kind of censorship should give some serious thought to how that sort of control could be used to suppress other sources of information.

post.title: President Trump to ban TikTok from the US today

body:
100% Tik Tok is soma for the retard masses, but people have a right to look at retarded shit on their phones.

It gets a little grey because this app is clearly being used to harvest data for Chinese intelligence agencies, and our fellow citizens are too retarded to stop using this garbage on their own. I can't see any other way to stop people from using this app and unintentionally feeding intelligence to the Chinese.

Still though, why the sudden focus on Tik Tok, and not all the other million ways China has their fingers in our IT infrastructure. I bet most phones out in the wild right now were manufactured in China, and who know what kind of backdoors they installed.
body_html:
100% Tik Tok is soma for the retard masses, but people have a right to look at retarded shit on their phones.

It gets a little grey because this app is clearly being used to harvest data for Chinese intelligence agencies, and our fellow citizens are too retarded to stop using this garbage on their own. I can't see any other way to stop people from using this app and unintentionally feeding intelligence to the Chinese.

Still though, why the sudden focus on Tik Tok, and not all the other million ways China has their fingers in our IT infrastructure. I bet most phones out in the wild right now were manufactured in China, and who know what kind of backdoors they installed.

body: he can't even do it in the first place, exec order or not. think about how you're gonna ban a fucking app? are the pigs gonna come to my house and remove it from my phone? even if the feds tried telling the ISPs to block the traffic, which many wouldn't, it would be an extremely difficult uphill battle in the courts. taking it down from play and apple stores would also be a similar battle if google/apple decided to tell trump to fuck off. even if somehow the ISP's did ban the traffic to the app, its pretty easy to circumvent.

#1. Things that are posted to News should be stated like a fact in the Headline.

In the sense, Headline: X happened or X said this. Not Personal opinions.

They should be reporting.

#2. Personal slant or commentary should go in the comments, not the Headline. Commentary content (like discussion commentator shows) are not News. Commentary content will be redirected to +Commentary which is for that purpose.

If it's News but is more an opinion piece please add [Opinion] in the title, or post in a topic specific guild.

#3. No screenshots; provide a link, provide a source.

See Posting Etiquette pin for further explanation.
guild.name: News

post.title: President Trump to ban TikTok from the US today
